news.title: Finished machine learning project on motor control and presented insights to MathWorks technical staff
Finished localizing Kindros's financial literacy website
Began machine learning and AI project with MathWorks
Ended summer research position as an undergraduate economics research fellow

about.bio:
Hi, I’m Aimee Hong! I’m a Computer Science and Economics student, with a minor in Finance and an expected graduation of May 2026. From taking courses in web application and iOS app development, to corporate finance, financial accounting, and game theory in economics, I've explored a wide range of topics that interest me. Currently, I’m honing my skills in software development, machine learning, and web development, with experience in Python, Java, C, Swift, JavaScript and more.

Beyond the classroom, I’ve worked as a Software Engineer Intern, where I localized a financial literacy platform to support Spanish translations, ultimately with the goal of making financial literacy more accessible to non-native English speakers. I’m also a teaching assistant for an introductory computer scinece course based in Python and will soon transition to being a teaching assistant for a Swift iOS app development undergraduate course.

Additionally, I'm a current participant in the Break Through Tech AI program at MIT, where I am part of a network that envisions women fairly represented in every room where technical decisions are made. I have benefited from engaging in real-world machine-learning industry projects and receiving mentorship from technical professionals. My projects span from building full-stack mobile apps to creating machine learning models. I love tackling new challenges, especially those that make a positive impact, and I have a passion for building meaningful technology.

projects.title: Recipe Bytes
projects.description: A full-stack cooking aid, meal recommender, and food tracker web application using React, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and Firebase.
projects.full_description: A full-stack cooking aid, meal recommender, and food tracker web application. The full-tech stack includes React, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Firebase, Material UI, and the Spoonacular API. The walkthrough video is narrated by Linda Zhang

projects.title: Recipe Bytes App
projects.description: A full-stack all-in-one cooking aid and food tracker iOS app using Swift and Firebase.
projects.full_description:
A full-stack all-in-one cooking aid and food tracker iOS app utilizing Firebase and API calls to TheMealDB. Techniques used include:
  • CloudFirestore
  • Firebase Login/Authentication
  • FirebaseStorage Image Sharing
  • MVVM organization
  • Custom Structs for data
  • Passing data between custom views
  • TheMealDB API and JSON parsing
  • TabView and hierarchical page navigation

projects.title: Motor Control Analysis
projects.description: A three month long machine learning project on supervised learning motor control analysis with MathWorks.
projects.full_description:
Coded a closed-loop machine learning system to predict motor control performance and anomalies using synthesized data from three-phase induction motors and presented insights to MathWorks technical staff. My team and I utilized synthesized data, classical motor theory, supervised learning, and deep learning approaches including Long Short-Term Memory and Convolutional Neural Networks. Here are our results:
  • Accuracy: 87.5%
  • Recall: 88.4%
  • Precision: 87.5%

projects.title: Weather App
projects.description: A weather app that displays the projected weekly weather forecast through API calls
projects.full_description: A weather app that displays the projected weekly weather forecast using API calls. It suppports different settings and the metric or imperial measurement systems

projects.title: To-Do List App
projects.description: A To-Do List iOS app using Swift Data.
projects.full_description: A To-Do List iOS app that can create, read, update, and delete entries using Swift Data. You can sort entries based on their name, when they were inputted, or its completion status to easily manage your tasks all in one app. This app was built from scratch using Swift and SwiftUI.

projects.title: Word Garden App
projects.description: A word-guessing UI app based on hangman
projects.full_description: A word-guessing UI app based on hangman that gives you eight guesses per word and will wilt the petals on your flower if you make incorrect guesses. Complete with sounds and animations.

projects.title: Math Tutor App
projects.full_description: A basic math app that utilizes emojis and sound effects to help younger demographics grasp addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.
